example.description: Creates a panel with two number selectors that play a male question sound byte and a female answer sound byte based on the new value of each number selector.
example.code:
-- Background panel
BGPanel = vgui.Create("DPanel")
BGPanel:SetPos(20, 20)
BGPanel:SetSize(100, 55)

-- Statement label
local lbl1 = vgui.Create("DLabel", BGPanel)
lbl1:SetPos(5, 5)
lbl1:SetSize(100, 20)
lbl1:SetText("Statement: ")
lbl1:SetColor(Color(64, 64, 255))

-- Response label
local lbl2 = vgui.Create("DLabel", BGPanel)
lbl2:SetPos(5, 30)
lbl2:SetSize(100, 20)
lbl2:SetText("Response: ")
lbl2:SetColor(Color(255, 0, 255))

-- Number selector for "questions"
local question = vgui.Create("DNumberWang", BGPanel)
question:SetPos(65, 5)
question:SetSize(30, 20)
question:SetMinMax(1, 30)

-- Number selector for answers
local answer = vgui.Create("DNumberWang", BGPanel)
answer:SetPos(65, 30)
answer:SetSize(30, 20)
answer:SetMinMax(1, 40)

-- This is used to prevent overlapping talking
local null = Sound("common/null.wav")

-- Abstraction = cleaner code
function TalkSound(snd)
	EmitSound(snd, LocalPlayer():GetPos(), LocalPlayer():EntIndex(), CHAN_VOICE, 1, 80, 0, 100)
end

-- Play a statement based on new number
function question:OnValueChanged(val)
	TalkSound(null)
	TalkSound(Sound("vo/npc/male01/question"..string.format("%02d", val)..".wav"))
end

-- Play an answer based on new number
function answer:OnValueChanged(val)
	TalkSound(null)
	TalkSound(Sound("vo/npc/female01/answer"..string.format("%02d", val)..".wav"))
end

function.name: CloseTab
function.description: Removes tab and/or panel from the parent DPropertySheet.

arg.text:
The DTab of the sheet from DPropertySheet.

See DPropertySheet:GetItems.
arg.name: tab

arg.text: Set to true to remove the associated panel object as well.
arg.name: removePanel

ret.text: The panel of the tab.

example.description: Example of how you'd create and use this panel and close unnecessary sheets.
example.code:
local MainFrame = vgui.Create( "DFrame" )
MainFrame:SetSize( 500, 300 )
MainFrame:Center()
MainFrame:MakePopup()

local MainSheet = vgui.Create( "DPropertySheet", MainFrame )
MainSheet:Dock( FILL )

local First_Panel = vgui.Create( "DPanel", MainSheet )
First_Panel.Paint = function( self, w, h ) draw.RoundedBox( 4, 0, 0, w, h, Color( 255, 128, 0, self:GetAlpha() ) ) end
MainSheet:AddSheet( "Users Page", First_Panel, "icon16/user.png" )

local Second_Panel = vgui.Create( "DPanel", MainSheet )
Second_Panel.Paint = function( self, w, h ) draw.RoundedBox( 4, 0, 0, w, h, Color( 0, 128, 255, self:GetAlpha() ) ) end
MainSheet:AddSheet( "Admins Page", Second_Panel, "icon16/lightning.png" )

if LocalPlayer():IsAdmin() then
	MainSheet:CloseTab( MainSheet:GetItems()[1].Tab ) --1 is a representation of the first sheet
else
	MainSheet:CloseTab( MainSheet:GetItems()[2].Tab ) --2 is a representation of the second sheet
end

function.name: GetRGB
function.description: Returns the color currently set on the color picker.

ret.text: The color set on the color picker, see Color.

example.description: Prints out the default set color.

description.text: Returns the color at given position on the internal texture.

arg.text: The X coordinate on the texture to get the color from
arg.name: x

arg.text: The Y coordinate on the texture to get the color from
arg.name: y

ret.text: Color
The X-coordinate clamped to the texture's width.
The Y-coordinate clamped to the texture's height.

description.text: Sets the color stored in the color picker.
description.note: This function is meant to be called internally and will not update the position of the color picker line or call DRGBPicker:OnChange

arg.text: The color to set, see Color.
arg.name: color

example.description: Defines a new function SetColor which will allow proper modification of the color picker directly.
example.code:
-- Background panel
BGPanel = vgui.Create("DPanel")
BGPanel:SetSize(100, 200)
BGPanel:Center()

-- Color picker
local color_picker = vgui.Create("DRGBPicker", BGPanel)
color_picker:SetSize(30, 150)
color_picker:Center()

-- Custom function that sets color picker position and updates color
function color_picker:SetColor(col)

	-- Get hue
	local h = ColorToHSV(col)
	
	-- Maximize saturation and vibrance
	col = HSVToColor(h, 1, 1)

	-- Set color var
	self:SetRGB(col)
	
	-- Calculate position of color picker line
	local _, height = self:GetSize()
	self.LastY = height*(1-(h/360))
	
	-- Register that a change has occured
	self:OnChange(self:GetRGB())

end

-- Update background color
function color_picker:OnChange(col)

	BGPanel:SetBackgroundColor(col)

end

-- Set to random color every second for 10 seconds
timer.Create("RandomizeColorPicker", 1, 10, function ()

	color_picker:SetColor(Color(math.random(0, 255), math.random(0, 255), math.random(0, 255), 255))
	
end)

function.name: OnChange
function.description: Function which is called when the cursor is clicked and/or moved on the color picker. Meant to be overridden.

arg.text: The color that is selected on the color picker (Color form).
arg.name: col

example.description: Creates a color picker which controls the color of a ball image.
example.code:
-- Frame
MainFrame = vgui.Create("DFrame")
MainFrame:SetSize(200, 200)
MainFrame:Center()
MainFrame:SetTitle("Pick a color")

-- Image of a ball
local ball_img = vgui.Create("DImage", MainFrame)
ball_img:SetPos(20, 45)
ball_img:SetSize(128, 128)

ball_img:SetImage("sprites/sent_ball")

-- Vertical color picker
local color_picker = vgui.Create("DRGBPicker", MainFrame)
color_picker:SetPos(165, 30)
color_picker:SetSize(25, 150)

function color_picker:OnChange(col)

	ball_img:SetImageColor(col)
	
end

example.code:
local DFrame = vgui.Create("DFrame")

DFrame:Center()
DFrame:MakePopup()
DFrame:SetTitle("Scrollbar Example")
function DFrame:Paint(w, h)
	draw.RoundedBox(0, 0, 0, w, h, Color(0, 100, 100))
end

local DScrollPanel = vgui.Create("DScrollPanel", DFrame)

DScrollPanel:Center()

local sbar = DScrollPanel:GetVBar()
function sbar:Paint(w, h)

end
function sbar.btnUp:Paint(w, h)
	draw.RoundedBox(0, 0, 0, w, h, Color(200, 100, 0))
end
function sbar.btnDown:Paint(w, h)
	draw.RoundedBox(0, 0, 0, w, h, Color(200, 100, 0))
end
function sbar.btnGrip:Paint(w, h)
	draw.RoundedBox(0, 0, 0, w, h, Color(100, 200, 0))
end

local str = ""
for i = 1, 50 do str = str .. "more space!\n" end

local DLabel = vgui.Create("DLabel", DScrollPanel)
DLabel:SetText(str)
DLabel:Center()
DLabel:SizeToContents()

function.name: AllowInput
function.description:
Called whenever the value of the panel has been updated (whether by user input or otherwise).

It allows you to determine whether a user can modify the TextEntry's text.

By default, this only checks whether the panel disallows numeric characters, preventing it from being edited if the value contains any.

This is actually an engine hook that only works on TextEntry derived elements.

arg.text: The last character entered into the panel.
arg.name: char

ret.text: Return `true` to prevent the value from changing, `false` to allow it.

example.description: Prevents the user from editing the text entirely.
example.code:
local TextEntry = vgui.Create( "DTextEntry" )
TextEntry.AllowInput = function( self, stringValue )
	return true
end
example.output: The panel does not allow any alterations.

function.name: GetAutoComplete
function.description: Called by the DTextEntry when a list of autocompletion options is requested. Meant to be overridden.

arg.text: Player's current input.
arg.name: inputText

ret.text: If a table is returned, the values of the table will show up as autocomplete suggestions for the user.

example.description: Shows a list of players to choose from.
example.code:
local frame = vgui.Create( "DFrame" )
frame:SetSize( 300, 300 )
frame:SetTitle( "Autocompletion Example" )
frame:Center()
frame:MakePopup()

local label = vgui.Create( "DLabel", frame )
label:SetText( "Type a player..." )
label:Dock( TOP )

local textentry = vgui.Create( "DTextEntry", frame )
textentry:Dock( TOP )
function textentry:GetAutoComplete( text )
    local suggestions = {}

    for _, ply in ipairs( player.GetAll() ) do -- For every player,
        if string.StartWith( ply:Nick(), text ) then -- if the player's name starts with it...
            table.insert( suggestions, ply:Nick() ) -- ... insert it into the list.
        end
    end

	return suggestions
end

You should override this function to define custom behavior when the DTextEntry text changes.

function.name: OnGetFocus
function.description: Called whenever the DTextEntry gains focus.

example.code:
local dTextEntry = vgui.Create("DTextEntry")
dTextEntry:SetText("Enter text here")

-- Make the text field clear when you click into it.
dTextEntry.OnGetFocus = function(self)
    self:SetValue("")
end
example.output: Text entry clears when user clicks it to begin typing

description.text: Called whenever enter is pressed on a DTextEntry.
description.note: DTextEntry:IsEditing will still return true in this callback!

arg.text: The current text of the DTextEntry
arg.name: value

example.code:
local TextEntry = vgui.Create( "DTextEntry" )
TextEntry:SetTextColor( Color( 255, 0, 0, 255 ) )

TextEntry.OnEnter = function()
    TextEntry:SetTextColor( Color( 0, 0, 255, 255 ) )
end
example.output: Changes the text color when enter is pressed.

function.name: OnLoseFocus
function.description: Called whenever the DTextEntry lose focus.

example.code:
local default = "Brick with bob"

local textentry = vgui.Create( "DTextEntry" )
textentry:SetText( default )
textentry.OnLoseFocus = function( self )
	if self:GetValue() == "" then
    	self:SetValue( default )
	end
end
example.output: DTextEntry value reset to default value if the text entered is empty.

function.name: OnKeyCode
function.description: Called from DTextEntry's TextEntry:OnKeyCodeTyped override whenever a valid character is typed while the text entry is focused.

arg.text: They key code of the key pressed, see Enums/KEY.

description.text:
Called internally when the text inside the DTextEntry changes.

You should not override this function. Use DTextEntry:OnValueChange instead.

arg.text: Determines whether to remove the autocomplete menu (false) or not (true).

description.text: Builds a DMenu for the DTextEntry based on the input table.
description.internal: You really should be using DTextEntry:GetAutoComplete instead.

arg.text: Table containing results from DTextEntry:GetAutoComplete.
arg.name: tab

function.name: OnValueChange
function.description:
Called internally when the text changes of the DTextEntry are applied. (And set to the attached console variable, if one is given)

See also DTextEntry:OnChange for a function that is called on every text change, even if the console variable is not updated.

You should override this function to define custom behavior when the text changes.

This method is called:
* When Enter is pressed after typing
* When DTextEntry:SetValue is used
* For every key typed - only if DTextEntry:SetUpdateOnType was set to true (default is false)

arg.text: The DTextEntry text.
arg.name: value

function.name: SetCursorColor
function.description: Sets the cursor's color in  DTextEntry (the blinking line).

arg.text: The color to set the cursor to.
arg.name: color

example.description:
Creates a panel and a DTextEntry, and then sets the cursor color. 
(As seen on https://maurits.tv/data/garrysmod/wiki/wiki.garrysmod.com/index9051.html)
example.code:
local ParentPanel = vgui.Create("DFrame")
	ParentPanel:SetSize(ScrW()/7, ScrH()/12)
	ParentPanel:Center()
	ParentPanel:SetTitle("Cursor Color Test")
	ParentPanel:SetDeleteOnClose(true)
	ParentPanel:MakePopup()
 
local TextEntry = vgui.Create( "DTextEntry", ParentPanel )
	TextEntry:SetSize(ScrW()/9, ScrH()/30)
	TextEntry:SetValue("Cursor Color Test ")
	TextEntry:SetPos(ParentPanel:GetWide()/2-TextEntry:GetWide()/2,
	ParentPanel:GetTall()/2-TextEntry:GetTall()/5)
	TextEntry:SetEnterAllowed(false)
 
	-- Uses Simple RGBA (Red, Green, Blue, Alpha) Colors. --
	TextEntry:SetCursorColor(Color(255,0,0,255))
 
	TextEntry:RequestFocus()
example.output: Makes the text entry's cursor color red.

function.name: SetEditable
function.description: Disables Input on a DTextEntry. This differs from DTextEntry:SetDisabled - SetEditable will not affect the appearance of the textbox.

arg.text: Whether the DTextEntry should be editable
arg.name: enabled

example.code:
local TextEntry = vgui.Create( "DTextEntry", frame ) -- create the form as a child of frame
TextEntry:SetPos( 25, 50 )
TextEntry:SetSize( 75, 85 )
TextEntry:SetText( "Sample String" )
TextEntry:SetEditable( false )

description.text: Disables input on a DTextEntry and greys it out visually. This differs from DTextEntry:SetEditable which doesn't visually change the textbox.

arg.text: Whether the textbox should be disabled
arg.name: disabled

function.name: SetEnterAllowed
function.description: Sets whether pressing the Enter key will cause the DTextEntry to lose focus or not, provided it is not multiline. This is true by default.

arg.text: If set to false, pressing Enter will not cause the panel to lose focus and will never call DTextEntry:OnEnter.
arg.name: allowEnter

function.name: SetFont
function.description: Changes the font of the DTextEntry.

arg.text: The name of the font to be changed to.
arg.name: font

example.description: Restores the original font the the DTextEntry.
example.code:
local textentry = vgui.Create("DTextEntry")
textentry:SetFont("DermaDefault")

function.name: SetMultiline
function.description: Enables or disables the multi-line functionality of DTextEntry.

arg.text: Whether to enable multiline or not.
arg.name: multiline

function.name: SetNumeric
function.description:
Sets whether or not to decline non-numeric characters as input.

Numeric characters are 1234567890.-

arg.text: Whether to accept only numeric characters.
arg.name: numericOnly

example.code:
local TextEntry = vgui.Create( "DTextEntry" )
TextEntry:SetNumeric(true)

function.name: SetPlaceholderText
function.description: Sets the placeholder text that will be shown while the text entry has no user text. The player will not need to delete the placeholder text if they decide to start typing.

example.description: This example shows what the placeholder text looks like
example.code:
concommand.Add( "test_textentry", function(ply)
	local frame = vgui.Create( "DFrame" )
	frame:SetSize( 400, 200 )
	frame:Center()
	frame:MakePopup()

	local TextEntry = vgui.Create( "DTextEntry", frame ) -- create the form as a child of frame
	TextEntry:Dock( TOP )
	TextEntry.OnEnter = function( self )
		chat.AddText( self:GetValue() )	-- print the form's text as server text
	end

	local TextEntryPH = vgui.Create( "DTextEntry", frame ) -- create the form as a child of frame
	TextEntryPH:Dock( TOP )
	TextEntryPH:DockMargin( 0, 5, 0, 0 )
	TextEntryPH:SetPlaceholderText( "I am a placeholder" )
	TextEntryPH.OnEnter = function( self )
		chat.AddText( self:GetValue() )	-- print the form's text as server text
	end
end )

function.name: SetTextColor
function.description: Sets the text color of the DTextEntry.

arg.text: The text color. Uses the Color.
arg.name: color

example.description: Changes the text color inside the DTextEntry to the color red.
example.code:
local Frame = vgui.Create("DFrame")
Frame:SetSize(200,200)
Frame:Center()
Frame:MakePopup()

local TextEntry = vgui.Create("DTextEntry", Frame)
TextEntry:SetSize(180,20)
TextEntry:SetPos(10,80)
TextEntry:SetTextColor(Color(255,20,20))
TextEntry:SetValue("Basic Text")

function.name: Layout
function.description: Resets the last width/height info, and invalidates the panel's layout, causing it to recalculate all child positions. It is called whenever a child is added or removed, and can be called to refresh the panel.

description.text: Called by PANEL:PerformLayout to arrange and lay out the child panels, if it has changed in size.

function.name: SetBaseSize
function.description:
Sets the size of a single tile. If a child panel is larger than this size, it will occupy several tiles.

If you are setting the size of the children properly then you probably don't need to change this.

arg.text: The size of each tile. It is recommended you use `2` (`16, 32, 64...`) numbers, and those above `4`, as numbers lower than this will result in many tiles being processed and therefore slow operation.

function.name: SetClickOnDragHover
function.description:
Enables the "click when drag-hovering" functionality.

If enabled, when hovering over any DTree_Node of this DTree while dragging a panel, the node will be automatically clicked on (and subsequently DTree:OnNodeSelected will be called) to open any attached panels, such as spawnlists in spawnmenu.

See also: PANEL:DragHoverClick.

description.text:
Does nothing. Is not called by the DTree itself.

Used as a placeholder empty function alongside DTree:ExpandTo, DTree:MoveChildTo and DTree:ChildExpanded to prevent errors when DTree_Node:SetExpanded is incorrectly used on a DTree.

function.name: OpenURL
function.description:
Instructs a HTML control to download and parse a HTML script using the passed URL.

This function can also be used on [HTML](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/HTML).

arg.text:
URL to open. It has to start or be one of the following:
* `http://`
* `https://`
* `asset://`
* `about:blank`
* `chrome://credits/`
arg.name: URL

example.description: Displays the Garry's Mod wiki page.
example.code:
local frame = vgui.Create( "DFrame" )
frame:SetTitle( "HTML Example" )
frame:SetSize( ScrW() * 0.75, ScrH() * 0.75 )
frame:Center()
frame:MakePopup()

local html = vgui.Create( "DHTML", frame )
html:Dock( FILL )
html:OpenURL( "wiki.facepunch.com/gmod" )

example.description: Displays the default loading screen from the HTML folder.
example.code:
local frame = vgui.Create( "DFrame" )
frame:SetTitle( "HTML Example" )
frame:SetSize( ScrW() * 0.75, ScrH() * 0.75 )
frame:Center()
frame:MakePopup()

local html = vgui.Create( "HTML", frame )
html:Dock( FILL )
html:OpenURL( "asset://garrysmod/html/loading.html" )

description.text: Sets the material used by the panel.
description.note: If the material is not showing up as the correct size, try setting the Material panel's `AutoSize` variable to **false**

arg.text: The file path of the material to set (relative to "garrysmod/materials/").
arg.name: matname

example.description: Creates a Material panel and sets the material to a screen space effect.
example.code:
-- Black background panel
BGPanel = vgui.Create("DPanel")
BGPanel:SetSize(200, 200)
BGPanel:Center()
BGPanel:SetBackgroundColor(Color(0, 0, 0, 255))
		
local mat = vgui.Create("Material", BGPanel)
mat:SetPos(5, 5)
mat:SetSize(190, 190)

-- It's not really good to use a models material for VGUI drawing
-- But it looks good enough for a quick demo
mat:SetMaterial("models/screenspace")

-- Stretch to fit
mat.AutoSize = false

enum.description:
Enumerations used by Entity:SetUseType. Affects when ENTITY:Use is triggered.

Not to be confused with Enums/USE used for ENTITY:Use and others.

item.text: Fire a  signal every tick as long as the player holds their use key and aims at the target.
Fires a  signal when starting to use an entity, and a  signal when letting go.
item.warning:
There is no guarantee to receive both ON and OFF signals. A signal will only be sent when pushing or letting go of the use key while actually aiming at the entity, so an ON signal might not be followed by an OFF signal if the player is aiming somewhere else when releasing the key, and similarly, an OFF signal may not be preceded by an ON signal if the player started aiming at the entity only after pressing the key.

Therefore, this method of input is unreliable and should not be used.

item.text: Like a wheel turning.
Fire a  signal only once when player presses their use key while aiming at the target.

item.text: None - default class for entities.
Players.
HL2 player allies - monster_barney, npc_citizen, hacked npc_manhack, and friendly npc_turret_floor.

HL2 vital player allies - npc_magnusson, npc_gman, npc_fisherman, npc_eli, npc_barney, npc_kleiner, npc_mossman, npc_alyx, npc_monk, npc_dog, and npc_vortigaunt at the end of EP2 (controlled by "MakeGameEndAlly" input).
HL2 antlions - npc_antlion, npc_antlionguard, and npc_ichthyosaur.
HL2 barnacles - npc_barnacle.
HL2 bullseyes - npc_bullseye.
HL2 passive/non-rebel citizens - npc_citizen in the beginning of HL2.
HL2 unused.

HL2 combine troops - npc_combine, npc_advisor, apc_missile, npc_apcdriver, hostile npc_turret_floor, hostile npc_rollermine, npc_turret_ground when active, npc_turret_ceiling when active, and npc_strider when active (not being carried by the gunship).
HL2 combine aircrafts - npc_combinegunship, npc_combinedropship, and npc_helicopter.
HL2 unused.
HL2 headcrabs - visible npc_headcrab.
HL2 manhacks - hostile npc_manhack not held by the gravity gun.
HL2 metro police - npc_metropolice and npc_vehicledriver.
HL2 combine military objects - func_guntarget, npc_spotlight, and active npc_combine_camera.
HL2 combine scanners - npc_cscanner and npc_clawscanner.
HL2 stalkers - npc_stalker.
HL2 vortigaunts - npc_vortigaunt before the end of EP2 (controlled by "MakeGameEndAlly" input).
HL2 zombies - unslumped npc_zombie, npc_poisonzombie, npc_fastzombie, npc_fastzombie_torso, and npc_zombine.
HL2 snipers - npc_sniper and proto_sniper.
HL2 missiles - rpg_missile, apc_missile, and grenade_pathfollower.
HL2 flares - env_flare.
HL2 animals - npc_crow, npc_seagull, and npc_pigeon.
HL2 friendly rollermines - hacked npc_rollermine.
HL2 hunters - npc_hunter.
HL:S turrets - monster_turret, monster_miniturret, monster_sentry.
HL:S friendly humans - monster_scientist.
HL:S human military - monster_human_grunt and monster_apache.

HL:S alien military - monster_alien_controller, monster_vortigaunt, monster_alien_grunt, monster_nihilanth, and monster_snark if it has an enemy of class CLASS_PLAYER, CLASS_HUMAN_PASSIVE, or CLASS_HUMAN_MILITARY.
HL:S monsters - monster_tentacle, monster_barnacle, monster_zombie, monster_gargantua, monster_houndeye, monster_ichthyosaur, and monster_bigmomma.
HL:S headcrabs - monster_headcrab.
HL:S alien predators - monster_bullsquid, xen_tree, and xen_hull.
HL:S insects - montser_roach and monster_leech.

HL:S enemy bioweapons - hornet fired by anyone but a player, or monster_snark with no enemy or an enemy without the class CLASS_PLAYER, CLASS_HUMAN_PASSIVE, or CLASS_HUMAN_MILITARY.

# Catch mouse wheel
You can catch the mouse wheel's value by:
```
local testVal = 0
hook.Add("InputMouseApply", "testMouseWheel", function(cmd, x, y, ang)
    testVal = testVal + cmd:GetMouseWheel() * 2 --any scale number you want to use
    print(testVal)
end)
```

enum.description: Enumerations used by Entity:SetRenderMode and Entity:GetRenderMode.

item.text: Default render mode. Transparently has no effect.

Supports transparency.

Use this to make alpha of Global.Color work for your entity. For players, it must be set for their active weapon aswell.

Intended for glowing sprites. Allows transparency, and forces the sprite or model to be rendered unlit.

The size of a sprite rendered with Glow is consistent with the screen size (unlike the alternative World Space Glow), making it appear larger at a distance, in comparison to the world.

The GlowProxySize keyvalue affects this Render Mode on sprites.
Enables Alphatesting. Legacy port from Goldsource. Obsolete in Source due to Alphatesting being handled in materials. Does not allow transparency.

Add the material's color values to the existing image, instead of performing a multiplication. Sprites will appear through world geometry and the sprite/model will always brighten the world. Allows transparency.
Causes the material to be not be drawn at all, similarly to Don't Render.
Functions like Additive, but also blends between animation frames. Requires the material to have a functioning animating texture. Allows transparency.
Functions similarly to Additive, except that the alpha channel controls the opacity of the sprite. An example of use is for dark sprites, with an example material being sprites/strider_blackball.vmt.

Functions similarly to Glow, with the exception that the size of the sprite is relative to the world rather than the screen.

The GlowProxySize keyvalue affects this Render Mode on sprites.

The entity is still being drawn and networked albeit invisible, therefore not making this Render Mode ideal for performance reasons.

To completely avoid drawing and networking an entity, see EF_NODRAW.

description.text:
Enumerations describing certain spawnflags. Everything except for SF_PHYS* and SF_WEAPON* is serverside only.

Spawnflags are set using Entity:SetKeyValue with **"spawnflags"** as the key.

* SF_CITIZEN_* spawnflags represent spawnflags only usable on [npc_citizen](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Npc_citizen).
* SF_NPC_* - Usable on all NPCs
* SF_PHYSBOX_* - Usable on [func_physbox](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Func_physbox)

enum.description:
Enumerations for use with render.SetStencilCompareFunction.

The comparison is between the reference value set by render.SetStencilReferenceValue, and the value of each pixel in the stencil buffer.

These enumerations are mirrors of Enums/STENCILCOMPARISONFUNCTION.

Also see this corresponding MSDN entry: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff476101%28v=vs.85%29.aspx.

item.text: Never passes.
Passes where the reference value is less than the stencil value.
Passes where the reference value is equal to the stencil value.
Passes where the reference value is less than or equal to the stencil value.
Passes where the reference value is greater than the stencil value.
Passes where the reference value is not equal to the stencil value.
Passes where the reference value is greater than or equal to the stencil value.
Always passes.

enum.description:
Enumerations for use with render.SetStencilPassOperation, render.SetStencilFailOperation and render.SetStencilZFailOperation.

These enumerations are mirrors of Enums/STENCILOPERATION.

item.text: Preserves the existing stencil buffer value.
Sets the value in the stencil buffer to 0.
Sets the value in the stencil buffer to the reference value, set using render.SetStencilReferenceValue.
Increments the value in the stencil buffer by 1, clamping the result.
Decrements the value in the stencil buffer by 1, clamping the result.
Inverts the value in the stencil buffer.
Increments the value in the stencil buffer by 1, wrapping around on overflow.
Decrements the value in the stencil buffer by 1, wrapping around on overflow.
